intro: Unonopsis duckei, commonly known as the Ducke's unonopsis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
